posts.post_content:
@bijart\_dauth: Earnest Fellowship is a global enchantment, it wouldn't disenchant itself because it doesn't go directly onto the Nephilim. Therefore, it essentailly becomes a blue creatuer with Intimidate; nothing but blue and colorless creatures could block it.
  
And the Wispersilk vs WoG statement was clearly sarcastic; Volcre was pointing out that good or not, WoG is everyone's default answer to anything with shroud ever.
posts.html:
@bijart_dauth: Earnest Fellowship is a global enchantment, it wouldn't disenchant itself because it doesn't go directly onto the Nephilim. Therefore, it essentailly becomes a blue creatuer with Intimidate; nothing but blue and colorless creatures could block it.
And the Wispersilk vs WoG statement was clearly sarcastic; Volcre was pointing out that good or not, WoG is everyone's default answer to anything with shroud ever.

posts.post_content:
Slap this guy on a **[Soul Foundry](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul Foundry)**. Suddenly his four colour mana cost becomes 4 colourless. And having multiple on the field would double, triple, etc. the amount of tokens you get, which is always nice.  
I play him in my monoblack [Chittering Rats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chittering Rats) /Soul foundry deck, and it's always a laugh when he hits the field.
posts.html:
Slap this guy on a Soul Foundry. Suddenly his four colour mana cost becomes 4 colourless. And having multiple on the field would double, triple, etc. the amount of tokens you get, which is always nice.
I play him in my monoblack Chittering Rats /Soul foundry deck, and it's always a laugh when he hits the field.

posts.post_content: Awesome synergy with [Earnest Fellowship](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Earnest Fellowship), which makes this creature unblockable most of the time.. Yeah, it can't block most creatures anymore, but it creates lots of colorless creature token that ~can~ be declared as blockers! :) Also interesting synergy with [Fervent Charge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fervent Charge), which turns this creature into a 5/5 attacker that has to be blocked or creates lots of 3/3 attackers for the next turn..
posts.html:
